item.title: A resolution honoring the life and recognizing the accomplishments of the Honorable Stephanie Tubbs Jones, Member of the House of Representatives for the 11th Congressional District of Ohio.

latestAction.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S8326; text as passed Senate: CR S8326; text of measure as introduced: CR S8279-8280)

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote. (text: CR H7826)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.(text: CR H7826)
The previous question was ordered without objection. (consideration: CR H7835)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1415.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H7826-7835)

summary.text:
Expresses the condolences of the House of Representatives on the death of the Honorable Stephanie Tubbs Jones, a former Representative from Ohio.

Declares that when the House adjourns on September 8, 2008, it stand adjourned as a further mark of respect to the memory of Representative Tubbs Jones.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Expresses the condolences of the House of Representatives on the death of the Honorable Stephanie Tubbs Jones, a former Representative from Ohio.

Declares that when the House adjourns on September 8, 2008, it stand adjourned as a further mark of respect to the memory of Representative Tubbs Jones.

bill.title: Expressing the condolences of the House of Representatives on the death of the Honorable Stephanie Tubbs Jones, a Representative of the State of Ohio.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
